185924075.review:
很不错的游戏，也为童年补个票，个人认为骑砍战团是一个优缺点十分明显的游戏（本人只玩过本体，此评论也仅针对于本体游戏内容。我没打过mod确实挺可惜的，毕竟骑砍的丰富性很大程度来自于mod）

个人认为骑砍战团是一个偏向于长线的游戏，从开局的奴隶贩子积累财富（积累财富的方式有很多，但感觉奴隶贩子是比较快速的办法），在酒馆寻找团队伙伴，到扩充军队，向一国称臣，占领一定城池之后可以选择自立或者继续为王国卖力，到最后统一大陆。游戏成就感很大程度上来自于最后的新王登基时刻，一路上的付出都是值得的。

不过，由此看来游戏的缺点也是十分明显的。相对来说，本体的任务系统到后期会变得十分单一，同时我玩了许多存档下来，后期的每一个国家的国王都会变得“昏聩”，动不动放逐忠臣把土地握在自己手里，变相逼迫玩家自立打天下。对于不喜欢长线游戏的玩家来说，骑砍并不合适。

希望我的评论能给想入手骑砍的玩家一点参考，个人还是很喜欢这款类型的游戏的。

185720077.review: Серія ігор Mount&Blade...В одному слові стільки різних емоцій і переживань, що їх вистачить вдосталь на пару років(враховуючи відсутність будь-яких цікавих подій). З самою серією познайомився ще в 2018 році, щоправда не з частиною Warband, а з With Fire&Sword, яка була встановлена на пристрої брата. Тоді я неначе занурився в світ,  зависаючи в ньому годинами використовуючи ще тоді чіт-коди на 1000 талерів Ctrl+X, моментальне знищення всіх противників на полі бою Ctrl+Alt+F4 та моментальна прокачка персонажа Ctrl+L, внаслідок чого, відчував себе нереально потужним лідером, через що проводити ігрові сеанси за саме цією грою хотілося ще більше, ніж до знання чіт-кодів. З Warband'ом познайомився в 2024 році на ютубі, дивлячись проходження, тому в тей момент захотілося придбати цей продукт. Як тільки з'явилися знижки на ігри, я моментально купив як саму гру, так і додатковий контент, про який не пошкодував, адже Viking Conquest був дійсно непоганою грою. Warband зумів зберегти чарівну атмосферу Кальрадії, де й без тебе можуть відбуватися абсолютно різні події: хтось грабує поселення та каравани, хтось бере в облогу замки та міста і захоплює їх, а хтось взагалі одружується, і це все без твоєї участі, адже ти не є головним героєм біля якого крутиться вся гра, ти лише як ентузіаст, який прийшов з далеких земель з своїми цілями та амбіціями. Окремо хотілося похвалити DLC Viking Conquest з наявністю сюжету та нових механік, яких може не вистачати навіть в Bannerlord. Вийшла дійсно непоганою в плані сюжету та можливостей вибору, які можуть напряму впливати на ваші відносини та наслідки. Warband'у вже 14 років(скоро буде 15), але вона все ще жива, на гру все ще виходять модифікації і в її все ще грають та знімають хоч і менше, але контент. Рекомендую гру з моєї суб'єктивної точки зору, ідеально підійде для слабких комп'ютерів на ноутбуків, а абсолютно вільні можливості в грі дадуть змогу не набриднути вам вивчати та покращуватися в грі.

185541070.review:
I picked this game up on a sale for 5 quid a few years ago in a sale on my old account, didn't have a clue what i was doing, just roamed the map picking fights with looters and doing side quests for lords, i enjoyed it greatly, i then discovered that i could join the Swadians. I was grated a village on the far reaches of the kingdom that was constantly looted, but i was born for greater things, I wanted a castle, and i found one, a small fort near the Khergits we were at war with, I had recruited a few mercenaries and more peasants to bolster my pitiful ragtag band of soldiers. We had just enough men to equal those in the fort. We charged, we climbed the ladder, we pushed them back, and i was knocked out, my men broke and i was captured. Thinking that King Harlaus would save me I waited patiently in the dungeon, and I waited and waited, my body began to waste away and i grew cold in the nights, but still i waited. I then began to wonder until low and behold a message was delivered to me, the king was holding a feast in the capital. I couldn't take any more, i had risked it all in a mad gamble for my king, and he had stabbed me in the back, dined on salted fish and butter while i starved, made merry while i lingered in isolation and filth. I bribed the guards to release me and made for new lands to seek a better king, Yarolek of the Vaegirs, i joined him only to be given a destroyed village and a place in the fight of a bitterly losing war. It was around this time that i began to research into the community of the game and discovered good was to train troops and, that you can, in fact, start your own kingdom. This was my chance, a means to stop my eternal struggle. I made for a castle recently taken by the Nords, overwhelmed the small garrison with my new, stronger army and forged my Kingdom. From there i grew, and grew and grew. My conquest new no bounds and before long i had control over the north and east of the map. I then launched a war against the Sarranids, hoping to establish dominion over as much territory as possible before trying to take Rhoodok forts. When disaster struck, the Sarranids and Rhoodoks had joined forces against me, i lost all the east, city after city, fort after fort and all hope seemed lost.
WHEN WHO DID COME TO MY AID BUT HARLAUS HIMSELF, that's right, he attacked the Rhoodoks for being too powerful, not me, but them. I realised now that my service did come with rewards, ones i was at the time too blind to see, i had a very high relationship score with Harlaus, he considered me his friend. with relief in the war, I destroyed the Sarranids and moved onto the Rhoodoks, with the assurance that i wouldn't be attacked in the back by the Swadians. Over the course of the game i slowly persuaded Swadian lords to join me, but I never did take the whole map, i left Praven, the city I arrived to Calradia in, the domain of Harlaus, my greatest ally, and greatest friend.
This game does not have a set story, you will most likely not have my game, yours will be different, and every save is different. I could tell you about the time i rose Vladim, the rightful king of the Vaegirs to the throne only to take over Vaegirs myself less than a month later, or the time I was a bandit, avoiding lords and raiding caravans and villages just to keep my men fed. But stop reading this, get out there and experience it yourself, who knows what stories you'll create.

185029083.review:
I can't believe I haven't upvoted this game sooner. This game is an absolute classic. A masterpiece of its time.

It's rough around the edges. Very rough in many ways, but it hits every note that matters. It's far from a AAA game, and that works to its benefit. This game has a whole lot of REAL SERIOUS LOVE AND PASSION put into its development. It's an imperfect game, but a perfect experience.

And if you want to play it in a way that corrects some of its rough edges, try the modding scene. Prophecy of Pendor, Perisno, Warsword Conquest, Phantasy Calradia, or the official Viking Conquest DLC are all fantastic ways to play the game. There's also mods for star wars, lord of the rings, and game of thrones. If you're into more historical mods, there's some good ones for sengoku era japan and the roman empire. Due to how mods work in this game (only one mod can be active at a time) they really inspired people to make wide sweeping overhauls, with quality of life mods merged in and included. I can't recommend this game enough. It's one of my all time favorites, and it will always be worth the money.

This is an old time classic. If your PC can't run Bannerlord or do you think it's simply too expensive? Get this instead on a sale, it goes on sale for -75% off all the time.

i don't think there is much to say about this game that already has not been said. It's the grandfather of sandbox medieval squad combat genre.

Here are [b]four[/b] tips that i wished i knew when i started playing this game:
[list]
[*] [b] DON'T [/b]start your first playthrough on hardcore mode (you can't save scum). You'll thank me later.
[*] Always fight your battles, SPECIALLY if you think its a battle that is [i] even,[/i]you will lose way more men by auto-battling instead of just fighting your own battles where in most favorable fights you would lose none.
[*] [b] Don't be at negative Honor,[/b] Don't Ignore it, specially if you are thinking on starting your own kingdom, the less honor you have the more likely it is for the other kingdoms and factions to declare war on you. If you make the same mistake as i did, and have -100 honor, everyone will hate you, and will relentlessly declare war on you.
[*] This game [b] Does not have Cloud Saving,[/b]so store your local saves somewhere on your cloud or a backup.
[/list]

184833367.review:
I really enjoyed the first 10–20 hours of playing, but the next 40+ hours felt incredibly boring. Deathless lords who can escape from any prison? Cringe. The lack of a 'kill lords' option feels nonsensical and restrictive, especially in a brutal medieval sandbox where life and death should matter. I love the battle and combat system, but I hate the mid and endgame mechanics of this game. Also later you will notice that there is no logic in the actions between the kingdoms. Everything is very scripted and monotonous.
The game is certainly worth its pennies to spend 10-15 hours. But what awaits the player later will be too disappointing to leave a positive review about the game. I haven't tried mods, maybe there will be something interesting there.

Geri kalana 4 yumurta, 1 paket vanilya, yarım su bardağı şeker ilave edilir. Biraz çırpılıp kabartma tozu ile elenmiş un konup karıştırılır. Kalıp yağlanır. Önceden ısıtılmış 170-180 derece fırında 35 dakika pişirilir. Fırından çıktıktan sonra sıcakken üzerine ayrılan 1 bardak karışım yavaş yavaş dökülür.

NOT: Yağı ılındırmanın sebebi şekerin tamamen eriyebilmesi için. Süt o yüzden sonradan katılıyor. Malzemeleri en az 20 dakika önce dolaptan çıkarıp oda sıcaklığında tutun.

Rakı oldukça değişik bir aroma veriyor.

183712376.review:
[i]“Король? Ні, це занадто просто. Я стану легендою, якій поклонятимуся усі!”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Mount & Blade: Warband[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

На момент виходу у 2010 році графіка Warband вже виглядала дещо застарілою. Текстури досить прості, анімації виглядають трохи «дерев'яними». Проте це компенсується стилем і дизайном. Ландшафти Калрадії — від засніжених гір до степів — створюють відчуття справжнього середньовічного світу. Система кастомізації героїв дозволяє створити унікального персонажа, хоча зовнішність NPC часто здається шаблонною.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Серце Warband — це його геймплей. Гравець починає як звичайний авантюрист і поступово створює свою долю: чи стане він найманцем, купцем, шляхтичем або навіть правителем власного королівства.

Система бою — це справжній шедевр, який поєднує реалізм із динамікою. Лицарські турніри, облоги замків і битви в полі дарують задоволення. Управління армією додає стратегічної глибини: гравець повинен враховувати позиції, тактику та мораль своїх воїнів.

Дипломатія також грає важливу роль. Гравець може укладати союзи, просити благородних титулів або навіть домовлятися про шлюб. Однак взаємодія з NPC часто обмежується простими діалогами.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Warband не має конкретного сюжету, але це одночасно і сильна сторона гри. Свобода дій дозволяє створити власну історію в цьому відкритому світі. Кожне ваше рішення впливає на те, як Калрадія реагуватиме на вас: чи будете ви грізним королем, якого бояться всі, чи шляхетним лицарем, якого шанують.

[b]Музика:[/b]

Саундтрек чудово передає атмосферу середньовічного світу. Інструментальні композиції створюють відчуття епічності під час битв і спокою в мирні моменти. Проте кількість треків невелика, і через кілька годин гри вони починають повторюватися.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Графіка та анімації виглядають застарілими.

Відсутність повноцінного сюжету може не сподобатися тим, хто любить чітко структуровані історії.

Повторюваність у музиці та деяких аспектах геймплею.

Інтерфейс часом здається незручним, особливо для новачків.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Mount & Blade: Warband отримує 7/10. Це гра, яка пропонує неймовірну свободу дій і глибокий геймплей, але її технічна складова вже застаріла.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

Warband — це унікальний досвід для любителів середньовіччя та відкритих світів. Вона дає вам змогу писати власну історію, боротися за королівство та відчувати дух епохи. Гра, яка, попри свої недоліки, залишається культовою для шанувальників жанру.

183707961.review:
I remember seeing this game and seeing the graphics (even back in 2016) were terrible and sitting on the fence but seeing overwhelmingly positive reviews and reading some of them and wondering "Should I buy this game?"  I finally came across a review that said something along the lines that you can be a bandit, warlord, or the line that captured my attention and pushed me to buy it "a noble knight who can protect the villagers/peasants" and I thought, alright, time to buy it.  

I took a chance on that alone and bought the game and got my butt kicked for quite a few hours, a bankrupt warband of angry, destitute men trying to scrap out a living and getting wasted by the nobles upon the map who had actual armies, fiefs and knew how to lead.  I've restarted many times and tried different things and always had fun and actually started my own faction and took over the entire map.

There is Bannerlord out which depending on which reviews you read is a much more beautiful version than this game with a larger map and far bigger and better battles.  This game is a very ugly (graphics wise) woman with a heart of gold who will never let you down.

My greatest moment in this game (I am not one of those players who can be a horse archer and take down 300 man armies by myself, maybe a dozen but no more than that) is when I engaged the king of the Rhodoks who has the best crossbowmen and spearmen in the game by far in open terrain with a band of around 160 Swadian knights against his 700+ army of elite Rhodok sergeants and sharpshooters.  The battle went on for quite a while and his reinforcements eventually dwindled to nothing and 800 casualties later it was over and the king's army forever reduced to never reach those heights again (at least in that map and play-through).  The reason for all of this bloodshed: in the defense of my small village the king tried to raid.  I had fulfilled my oath and the draw of the game back to me.

I highly recommend this game.  It is all open-world meaning there is no story line in the vanilla game (Viking DLC and mods will correct that if that is what you are looking for).  So the open vanilla map will either be the most boring time or the greatest story line depending upon how you craft it in your own mind and also how some battles and betrayals and sworn oaths are fulfilled.

I figure at this point most, if not all will go for Bannerlord but I will always come back to this game, even with Bannerlord and other bigger and more beautiful battle games out there.  This was a love that will never leave me.  Also if you can't afford Bannerlord or you have a potato of a computer than this will fulfill those needs until you can afford those luxuries.
